prompt: Suppose that $f$ is a polynomial such that \[(x-1)\cdot f(x)=3x^4+x^3 - 25x^2 +38x -17.\]What is the degree of $f$?Please reason step by step, and put your final answer within \boxed{}.
output:
We can expand the left-hand side of the equation:

\begin{align*}(x-1)\cdot f(x)&=xf(x)-f(x)\\&=xf(x)-f(x).\end{align*}Equating this to the right-hand side, we have

$$xf(x)-f(x)=3x^4+x^3-25x^2+38x-17.$$We can rearrange this to get

$$xf(x)=3x^4+x^3-25x^2+38x-17+f(x).$$We can then factor out an $x$ from the right-hand side:

$$xf(x)=x(3x^3+x^2-25x+38)+(-17+f(x)).$$We can then divide both sides by $x$ to get

$$f(x)=3x^3+x^2-25x+38+\frac{-17+f(x)}{x}.$$We can then subtract $\frac{-17+f(x)}{x}$ from both sides to get

$$f(x)-\frac{-17+f(x)}{x}=3x^3+x^2-25x+38.$$We can then simplify the left-hand side to get

$$\frac{x\cdot f(x)+17-f(x)}{x}=3x^3+x^2-25x+38.$$We can then multiply both sides by $x$ to get
